cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 30 mi (50 km) south of Cape Fear, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: moving northeast parallel to the U.S. East Coast, accelerating past the Mid-Atlantic offshore and toward Nova Scotia
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the North Carolina coast (Cape Fear–Wilmington area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch area south of the South Santee River; Tropical Storm Watch portions of Mid-Atlantic and southeastern New England (per advisory text)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Cape Fear NC to NC/VA border; Tropical Storm Warning NC/VA border to Fenwick Island DE, Chesapeake Bay south of Drum Point, Woods Hole MA to Sagamore Beach MA including Nantucket & Martha’s Vineyard
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast U.S. through Mid-Atlantic and southern New England coasts, with strongest effects along the North Carolina Outer Banks then offshore toward Nova Scotia
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤6%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts 30–40 mph possible late Fri night into Sat morning as the core passes ~150–200 mi SE of the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for New York Harbor; no surge watch/warning in effect.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands could bring 1–2 inches of rain Friday night–Saturday, well below 4-inch threshold.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along New Jersey and Long Island beaches through Saturday.
